text: <@U02618EV1>, is what you need for the philosophy page video the same as for swoosh: mp4 file, vimeo ID, poster frame image url?

and <!channel>, so far I have the following sizes for images: Eats desktop (645x164). Eats mobile (1280x650). Cocktails desktop (1280x354) Cocktails Mobile (1280x650), Philosophy Poster Frame (1152 x 550 ). Can I get confirmation on which, if any, of these I need to generate retina counterparts for? And I am still missing the size for the small cocktail image with the circle mask on desktop. Can I get that at some point today too?
<@U02613K0X> RE: the video, we a vimeo link in the format: "<https://vimeo.com/102928258>"
And also a field for the image that shows at the top of the page. This isn't necessarily a poster frame but it's related to the video.
that path is just the vimeo id right? so i’ll just give you the vimeo id and the url to the image?
I think it's preferable to get the full url in case the client wants to use youtube or something else in the future.
okay so the video url and the url to the image?
is all you need
Image should be uploaded to the CMS
yes
i’m going to upload it to s3 and give you the url
Got it. Yes.
Also, those image sizes are missing some of the details <@U026AP8CM> and I discussed last week. Eg: Cocktails has 2 image sizes. One is for the full screen images and another for the ones in circles.
So I'm going to go ahead and spend some time again getting all that info so we can avoid confusion.
okay. thanks so much gaston, sorry for the trouble.
No worries. Not your fault and I feel bad these images have been blocking you for days.
Let me know if you need a text version to copy/paste.
awesome!
one size on philosophy video image?
Yes
Basecamp link for future ref: <https://basecamp.com/1848688/projects/5657876/messages/29795089#events_message_29795089>
this is perfect thanks gaston!!

The four automatic Tank sensors are low, so you are most likely getting accurate readings.
He also informed me, that the numeric value for the Tanks (not the kegs) would never go above 440. Sounds like 440 will be the 100% full.
recent note from client
ha okay cool. so “Tanks” are 0-440 and “Kegs” are 0-4095.
i hope it helps
or does it confuse things more
and my readings are saying that two tanks and one keg are empty. hopefully that’s accurate
I'll ask if that's accurate
it’s fine i just have to convert the values to percentages differently
for kegs vs tanks
<@U026AP8CM> I asked that in my last email. He says its correct
<@U026AP8CM> do you happen to have the URL and credentials for their third party sharing service? I can't find them on my emails.
one second i can look
Thanks.
